post.description: Handle anonymous agent streaming requests (public agents only).

Upload image for public agents (anonymous access).

Workflow:
1. Get agent and verify it's public
2. Verify image attachment is enabled
3. Apply rate limiting (10 uploads per IP per hour)
4. Validate file metadata (size, type)
5. Get or create /agents/user-uploads folder
6. Call UploadService to create upload session and presigned URL
7. Return presigned URL to client
8. Client uploads to S3 and calls /drive/uploads/complete

:param agent_id: agent identifier
:param upload_request: upload request with file metadata
:param request: FastAPI request object for rate limiter
:param agent_service: agent service
:param upload_service: upload service
:param item_service: item service for folder management
:return: upload response with presigned URL
:raises WorkflowChefClientError: if validation fails or rate limit exceeded

get.description:
Get all supported MAS node types with their input/output schemas and metadata.

This endpoint provides comprehensive information about all available node types
in the MAS workforce system, including their JSON schemas, descriptions, use cases,
and example configurations.

Returns:
    MASNodeTypesListResponse: Complete information about all supported node types including:
        - Node type identifier and human-readable name
        - Detailed description and category classification
        - JSON schemas for input and output validation (generated from Pydantic models)
        - Common use cases and practical examples
        - Example input configurations for each node type

Response Structure:
    ```json
    {
        "node_types": [
            {
                "type": "AGENT",
                "name": "AI Agent",
                "description": "Executes an AI agent to process messages and generate responses.",
                "category": "AI",
                "input_schema": {
                    "type": "object",
                    "properties": {
                        "agent_id": {"type": "string", "description": "ID of the agent to execute"},
                        "thread_option": {"enum": ["CREATE_NEW", "USE_EXISTING"], ...},
                        "message": {"type": "string", ...}
                    },
                    "required": ["agent_id", "thread_option"]
                },
                "output_schema": {
                    "type": "object",
                    "properties": {
                        "thread_id": {"type": "string"},
                        "last_message": {"type": "string"},
                        "structured_output": {"type": "object"}
                    }
                },
                "use_cases": [
                    "Content generation",
                    "Data analysis and insights",
                    "Decision making"
                ],
                "examples": [
                    {
                        "description": "Basic agent with new thread",
                        "input": {
                            "agent_id": "agent-123",
                            "thread_option": "CREATE_NEW",
                            "message": "Analyze this data: {{trigger.user_input}}"
                        }
                    }
                ]
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

Categories:
    - **Core**: Essential workflow components (TRIGGER, STATE_MODIFIER, OUTPUT)
    - **AI**: AI-powered processing nodes (AGENT)
    - **Integration**: External system connections (TOOL, PLUGIN)
    - **Logic**: Flow control and decision making (CONDITION, LOOP)
    - **Utilities**: Helper and organizational nodes (NOTE, PAUSE)

Use Cases:
    - **UI Generation**: Use schemas to dynamically generate node configuration forms
    - **Validation**: Validate node configurations against the provided JSON schemas
    - **Documentation**: Display comprehensive information about each node type
    - **Examples**: Provide pre-filled examples for user guidance
    - **Type Discovery**: Allow users to explore available functionality

Schema Information:
    - All schemas are auto-generated from Pydantic models ensuring accuracy
    - Schemas include field types, descriptions, validation rules, and default values
    - Input schemas define what configuration is required for each node
    - Output schemas describe the structure of data produced by each node

Security:
    - Requires valid authentication but no specific workspace permissions
    - Node type information is considered public metadata within the system

Get public information about a MAS workforce using its public key.

This endpoint provides basic information about a publicly accessible MAS
without requiring authentication. It's designed for iframe/embed integration
where the client needs to display basic MAS details.

Args:
    public_key: The public key of the MAS workforce

Returns:
    PublicMASInfoResponse: Basic MAS information including id, name, description

Raises:
    404: If the MAS is not found, not public, or public key is invalid

post.description:
Execute a public MAS workforce using its public key.

This endpoint allows iframe/embed integration to execute a MAS workforce
without authentication. The MAS must be configured as public and have a
valid public key to be accessible through this endpoint.

Args:
    public_key: The public key of the MAS workforce
    request: PublicMASRunRequest containing:
        - trigger_data: Dict[str, Any] - Input data to trigger the workflow
        - thread_id: Optional[str] - ID of existing thread or None to create new
        - stream: bool - Whether to stream the response (default: True)

Returns:
    StreamingResponse: Server-Sent Events stream with execution events

Response Format:
    Same as the authenticated run endpoint - see main run_workforce documentation
    for detailed event types and response format.

Trigger Actor Information:
    When running through this public endpoint, the following trigger info is stored:
    - trigger_actor_type: "EMBED"
    - trigger_actor_id: public_key (the public key used)
    - trigger_actor_metadata: {
        "source": "iframe",
        "public_key": public_key,
        "user_agent": request.headers.get("user-agent"),
        "referer": request.headers.get("referer"),
        "origin": request.headers.get("origin")
      }

Raises:
    404: If the MAS is not found, not public, or public key is invalid
    400: If the request data is invalid
    500: If execution fails

post.description:
Complete an upload after client uploads to S3.

Call this immediately after successfully uploading to the presigned URL.
This provides instant feedback without waiting for S3 webhook.

Workflow:
1. Client uploads file to presigned URL from /uploads/sessions
2. On success (200 OK), client calls this endpoint with session_id
3. Server fetches file metadata from S3 (size, etag)
4. Server creates content blob and marks item as ACTIVE
5. Item immediately appears in listings
6. S3 webhook (if configured) becomes idempotent

:param request: complete upload request with session_id
:param service: upload service
:return: completed upload response with item ID and status
:raises WorkflowChefClientError: if validation fails

Handle S3 ObjectCreated event notifications.

This endpoint is called by S3 event notifications (via SNS/SQS/Lambda)
when a file upload completes. It creates the corresponding item record.

:param event: S3 event notification payload
:param service: S3 event service
:return: success status with processed count and errors
:raises WorkflowChefClientError: if critical error occurs

schema.title: Response Handle S3 Object Created V1 Drive S3 Events Object Created Post

post.description:
Handle S3 ObjectRemoved event notifications.

This endpoint is called when objects are deleted from S3
(manually or via lifecycle policies). It decrements usage statistics.

Note: This does NOT delete items from the database. Items should be
soft-deleted via the API, which then triggers S3 cleanup separately.
This handler only updates usage stats for orphaned S3 deletions.

:param event: S3 event notification payload
:param service: S3 event service
:return: success status with processed count

schema.title: Response Handle S3 Object Removed V1 Drive S3 Events Object Removed Post

AgentThreadStatus.title: AgentThreadStatus
AgentThreadStatus.description:
The status of the agent thread.

Status meanings:
- IDLE: Thread is newly created and waiting for user interaction
- QUEUED: Thread is scheduled but hasn't started yet (Upcoming Queue)
- IN_PROGRESS: Thread is currently being processed by the agent
- PROCESSED: Thread has completed successfully
- FAILED: Thread encountered errors during execution
- CANCELLED: Thread was cancelled (defined but not implemented yet)

HumanMessage.title: HumanMessage
HumanMessage.description:
Message from a human.

HumanMessages are messages that are passed in from a human to the model.

Example:

    .. code-block:: python

        from langchain_core.messages import HumanMessage, SystemMessage

        messages = [
            SystemMessage(
                content="You are a helpful assistant! Your name is Bob."
            ),
            HumanMessage(
                content="What is your name?"
            )
        ]

        # Instantiate a chat model and invoke it with the messages
        model = ...
        print(model.invoke(messages))

MASWorkforceBulkUpdateDTO.title: MASWorkforceBulkUpdateDTO
MASWorkforceBulkUpdateDTO.description:
DTO for bulk updating nodes and edges in a workforce.

This represents the desired end state of the workforce. The system will:
- CREATE nodes/edges that exist in the payload but not in current workforce
- UPDATE nodes/edges that exist in both payload and current workforce
- DELETE nodes/edges that exist in current workforce but not in payload

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the node. Must be unique within the workflow and follow snake_case naming convention. And must not duplicate with any field name in the workflow input. Node name should be concise, descriptive and meaningful.

node_type_name.title: Node Type Name
node_type_name.description: Name of the node type. Must be a valid node type name that defined in the list of node types.

input_config.title: Input Config
input_config.description:
Input configuration of the node. Refer to the input schema of the node type specified in the node_type_name field. Each key in the input configuration must be a valid input field name of the node type. The value of each key must be a valid input value of the input field or a reference to the output of another node in the workflow or the workflow input field. Only references to the value of the the fields, don't pipe with any function or operation.
Use the following format to refer to the output of another node: {{<<node_name>>.<<output_field_name>>}}. 
Use the following format to refer to the workflow input field: {{<<field_name>>}}.

VariableScopeType.title: VariableScopeType
VariableScopeType.description:
Scope types for variables.

Variables can be scoped to different levels:
- PROJECT: Shared across all resources in a project
- WORKFLOW: Specific to a workflow
- AGENT: Specific to an agent
- MAS: Specific to a MAS/workforce

VariableType.title: VariableType
VariableType.description:
Type definitions for variables.

The type describes the data type of the variable value.
Use `is_secret=True` flag for sensitive values that need encryption.

Attributes:
    STRING: Text values
    INTEGER: Whole numbers
    NUMBER: Decimal numbers (float)
    BOOLEAN: True/false values
